description: Massive growth in the size of business datasets leads many companies to Hadoop, an emerging architecture for parallel data processing (and top-level Apache project). However, the migration path can be challenging, in part because MapReduce analyses use programming languages like Java and Python rather than SQL. Apache Pig is a high-level framework built on top of Hadoop that offers a powerful yet vastly simplified way to analyze data in Hadoop. It allows businesses to leverage the power of Hadoop in a simple language readily learnable by anyone that understands SQL. In this presentation, I will introduce Pig and show how it’s been used at Twitter to solve numerous analytics challenges that became intractable with our former MySQL-based architecture.
title: Hadoop, Pig, and Twitter
